alert.note: Alert for Breckinridge; Hancock (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 10:31AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Perry, Hancock and west central Breckinridge Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 931 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hawesville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Perry, Hancock and west central Breckinridge Counties, including the following locations... Skillman, Goering, Pellville, Lewisport, Dodd, Tobinsport, Holt, Sunny Corner, Cannelton and Rome. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for south central Indiana...and central Kentucky.
